item.title: Falling leaves cover pavement and slippy, 14th November
item.description:
Amount of wet leaves on uneven pavement are treacherous- Camden roads swept regularly but Brent pavements with trees are now Dangerous to walk along thank you
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Christchurch Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No lighting at all in underpass - dangerous!, 14th November
item.description:
None of the lighting in the pedestrian underpass at sun in sands roundabout is working. With dark nights early on this is a real concern for pedestrian safety - for children walking home from school, bikes may not see them, or worse may happen with muggings or violent attacks. Please get this sorted asap!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shooters Hill Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row

item.description:

item.title: Lockable gate required, 14th November
item.description:
The Y building builders have advised me that our lovely old Victorian gates are being restored and will be returned and automated. Alongside that will be an automated pedestrian gate. Which all sounds great. 1. I am concerned about our blind visitors to the park and how they will be able to navigate the pedestrian automated gate. 2. An automated order and vehicle gate will not stop the occupants of the Y building gaining 25/7 access to Bromley Palace Park unless there is a secondary pedestrian gate, further up the pathway on route to the park. Please can this be looked in to. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rafford Way, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durfey Place, Camberwell, London

item.title: TPO protected tree damaged, 14th November
item.description:
A TPO was granted for the tree the stands to the entrance to the St Blaise Building (May 2025), reference 515931. Galliard Homes are permitting their current film crew to damage to branches of the tree. I have spoken to the film crew several times, advising them of the TPO, but barriers, boxes, scaffolding and ladders keep getting propped up against the tree, or worse still, thrown on the tree, damaging small branches. This was once a wonderful tree. It’s starting to grow back really well, it doesn’t need any more set backs. Please stop them from causing more damage to this tree which is supposed to be protected.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Avenue, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branches and roots vandalised, 14th November
item.description:
These trees are meant to be protected by TPO reference number 3000. UK power networks said they had been given authority by Galliard Homes to cut all the tree back and dig up the roots. I explained that the trees were subject to TPO’s therefore they would need Bromley Councils permission to do anything at all to these trees and showed them a map of the TPOs in my phone. Galliard Homes have butchered these trees that are meant to be protected by TPOs. They have cut branches off as high as 12 feet up and dug out lots of the protected tree roots.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Blaise Avenue, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
